org.aludratest.testcase.data.impl.xml

Class XmlBasedTestDataProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.aludratest.testcase.data.impl.xml.XmlBasedTestDataProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TestDataProvider

    public class XmlBasedTestDataProvider
extends Object
implements TestDataProvider
    An XML based Test Data provider. XML files must have the AludraTest XML Testdata format; best use AludraTest VDE Plugin for eclipse to create testdata files. The uri value of Source annotations must point to an XML file. This file is searched in these two locations:
    1. In a folder xlsRootPath/package/of/testclass/as/folder/MyTestClass/
    2. Relative to xlsRootPath
    xlsRootPath value is configured in aludratest.properties.
    Author:
    falbrech

        public List<TestCaseData> getTestDataSets(Method method)
        Description copied from interface: TestDataProvider
        Callback method by which the framework requests test data for the given method.
        Specified by:
        getTestDataSets in interface TestDataProvider
        Parameters:

      • evaluate

        public String evaluate(String script,
                       String formatPattern,
                       Locale locale,
                       Map<String,Object> contextVariables)
        Evaluates the given data script, applying the given format pattern and locale, if specified.
        Parameters:
        script - Script to evaluate, e.g. addDaysToNow(5)
        formatPattern - Format pattern to apply. Can be a format accepted by SimpleDateFormat or DecimalFormat, depending on type of expression. If not specified, a type-specific default format is used. If the expression evaluates to a String, this parameter is ignored.
        locale - Locale to apply to the format pattern. If not specified, Locale.US is used (NOT the platform default, to ensure platform-independent operation).
        contextVariables - Map with objects which should be offered in the script context as variables. Can be null.
        Returns:
        the result of the script
